question: In which year National Commission for Minorities was established?
explanation: Officially, there are 6 minorities in India viz. Muslims, Christians, Sikhs, Buddhists, Parsis and Jains. The Union Government set up the National Commission for Minorities (NCM) under the National Commission for Minorities Act, 1992. The commission is made up of a Chairperson, a Vice Chairperson and five members.Â Unlike other bodies like NCSC and NCST, NCM has no constitutional backing or status.
